masterFinding.verificationInstructions:
Verification Instructions

Review server responses for pages / functionality that display masked passwords to determine whether passwords are masked client-side or server-side.

Reporting Requirements
  1. Show application page / functionality that contains masked passwords

  2. Show server response containing cleartext credentials
masterFinding.remediationInstructions: The application should never return user credentials to the client. Change the application to prevent it from returning any user passwords in server responses.
masterFinding.name: Information Disclosure - Password in Server Response
masterFinding.businessImpact: Successful exploitation of the vulnerability could allow an attacker to log into the application as the compromised user and view sensitive data or take actions as that user within the application.
masterFinding.description: A cleartext password is available once a valid user has logged into the application. However, if a user leaves their computer unattended, a malicious user with physical access to the machine could recover a user's password from the browser.
